page.title: 06DOVE BANK PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: {Dove Bank Primary School}was opened in January 1982, following the closure and amalgamation of three small village schools in Bagworth, Battram and Nailstone. It's name comes from a local field, Dove Bank Meadow. It was built for 120 children and was partly financed by money from the National Coal Board because of the effects of mining subsidence on the old school buildings. Three bells from the original schools are incorporated into the present school entrance. The school is{open-plan}design with four class areas, a quiet room, a hall, a kitchen and the usual administrative rooms. It is staffed by a Headteacher and three teachers. In 1985 the maximum number on roll at the school was 107 children. The school is well{ {equipped}with two computers, a video recorder, a kiln and two televisions.
